article_title: Hungry Crowds at U.S. Open Challenge Chefs
article_text:
One of the fiercest competitions for a slot at the U.S. Open may have occurred off the court: In a city teeming with food trucks, officials plucked one to introduce the popular trend at 2014's event.

Morris Grilled Cheese Truck, helmed by owner and chef Michael Jacober, a veteran of fine dining spots like Per Se, will park outside Court 17...

twitter.description: Chefs say preparing for the U.S. Open—the largest annual sporting event in the world—presents a unique challenge. More than 700,000 guests will be served at 60 concession stands, five restaurants and 100 luxury suites during the tournament, which starts Monday.
twitter.creator: @hollanderfiles
